firefox.notes: Before Firefox 50, when the debugger is open, scripts are not always loaded in the order given in the array.

chrome.notes: If an extension defines a browser action, it is not allowed to define a page action as well.

opera.notes: If an extension defines a browser action, it is not allowed to define a page action as well.

safari.notes: If an extension defines a browser action, it is not allowed to define a page action as well.

chrome.notes: SVG icons are not supported.

notes: SVG icons are not supported.
'default_icon' must be an object, with explicit sizes.

safari.notes: SVG icons are not supported. Grayscale images will be treated as template icons and processed with the system accent color and system appearance.

firefox_android.notes: Browser actions are presented as menu items, and the title is the menu item's label.

firefox.notes: The user is asked to opt into the default search change unless it is a built-in engine.

chrome.notes: If two or more extensions both define a custom new tab page, then in Firefox the first extension to run wins. In Chrome the last extension wins.

edge.notes: If two or more extensions both define a custom new tab page, then in Firefox the first extension to run wins. In Edge the last extension wins.

firefox.notes: If two or more extensions both define a custom new tab page, then in Firefox the first extension to run wins. In Chrome the last extension wins.

safari.notes: An extension can define a custom new tab or window page, but it does not take effect until the user chooses the extension to override the page in Safari's General preferences.
Ability to change the keyboard shortcut for a command not supported.

notes: macOS support requires the global command feature which isn't supported yet. See Bug 1251795.

chrome.notes: Content scripts are not applied to tabs already open when the extension is loaded.

opera.notes: Content scripts are not applied to tabs already open when the extension is loaded.

safari.notes: Content scripts are not applied to tabs until the user grants permission via the extension's access popover in the toolbar.

firefox.notes: Content scripts won't be injected into empty iframes at 'document_start' even if you specify that value in 'run_at'.

firefox_android.notes: Content scripts won't be injected into empty iframes at 'document_start' even if you specify that value in 'run_at'.

safari.notes: Content scripts are not applied to tabs until the user grants permission via the extension's access popover in the toolbar. Additional loads after permission is granted will respect run_at.

edge.notes: Only the default content security policy is supported: "script-src 'self'; object-src 'self';".

firefox.notes: Firefox does not support 'http://127.0.0.1' or 'http://localhost' as script sources: they must be served over HTTPS.

chrome.notes: Chrome does not support SVG format for icons. It is recommended to use PNG images.

safari.notes: Options pages are always opened in a separate browser tab.
